nodes.text:
06/28 

I’ve held off on watching this for too long. #WhenTheySeeUs 

You might have to take breaks to get through it. But remember: We don’t get a break from being Black in America.

07/04 TALK TO YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY about colonization, the enslavement black human beings, & what the founding fathers really meant when they said “ALL MEN ARE CREATED EQUAL.”\n\nI’m not saying don’t celebrate. I’m saying don’t ignore history. Confront it. Face it.

06/24 

Google search: School to Prison Pipeline. Don’t just skim the infographics

Read what the ACLU and Justice Policy Institute have to say about this. 

Read a peer reviewed study about this. 

What are your initial thoughts? What can you do TODAY to bring attention to this?

JUNETEENTH ACTION ITEMS: 

Seek out BLACK JOY (we are more than our struggle)

Make a black person in your life smile today

Use Yelp to find a black owned business to patron today

Follow @ tenacioustweets on insta for shoutouts of amazing black women & other ways to celebrate
06/11 ACTION ITEM \n\nResearch the history of #Juneteenth and find an upcoming webinar/local event/IG live stream to see how it ties into modern day life.

06/10 Action Item: Stop and digest some of the information you’ve been given. Stop trying to consume/share on social ; consume/share on social ; consume ; consume ; consume.\n\nWhat’s one thing you learned about systemic racism today? What’s one thing you can TEACH your network?

06/09 Action Item: If you’re not willing/able to protest. \n\nFind out if you can register people to vote instead! Many organizations are looking for volunteers to help with voter registration. Slide into their instagram DMs and see who needs help.

Almost forgot today’s action item:

Find out how much your city spends on police funding. Compare that to how much it spends on education, public health, transportation, etc. 

For example, PHX has a budget of $944 million for police (& is requesting $25 million more)
06/07 Action Item:\n\nText 10 friends/family members to watch 13th on Netflix. Here’s a screenshot of my 70yr old white aunt’s response after watching. https://t.co/4xCTCu9MP7

06/06 Action Item: 

Sign up for a seminar, town hall, or virtual meeting. Add it to your calendar so you don’t forget

- NAACP is hosting one with Joe Biden on Wednesday

- “Showing Up for Racial Justice: White People's Work to End Racism” is a Zoom webinar tomorrow night

Today’s action item: 

Follow 10-15 black influencers on instagram & twitter (ideally a few from your local city/state!)

If I’m the only black voice on your feed that’s a PROBLEM

I wont be giving recommendations, I’m confident you can do this on your own, please don’t ask me

This is a marathon, not a sprint. 

I’ll be posting one simple action item at a time, to make this a bit easier to digest. Follow @ tenacioustweets on instagram for more content & a link to my action plan! 

Remember the priorities: #DefundThePolice #BlackLivesMattter
